title: Compiler run crashes when importing and calling a public function (mud)
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (0078471 2023-02-27T00:11:17.287038Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge build

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

`forge build` crashes when importing and calling a public function. Tested using mud (https://github.com/latticexyz/mud).

Error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2308546/221408686-d5a86ece-36cc-4781-bf10-305e70b4131d.png)

```
stderr: The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value
Location: cli/src/cmd/forge/script/executor.rs:48

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.

Cleaning up deployment script

-----------
Error during generateAndDeploy (see above)
```

Minimal reproduction: 
- Clone: https://github.com/emersonhsieh/mud-noise-bug
- Deploy with `yarn`, `yarn workspace contracts devnode`, and `yarn workspace contracts dev`

Line in question: https://github.com/emersonhsieh/mud-noise-bug/blob/ea9919bec6df19523087020566006ab6e29c10c6/packages/contracts/src/systems/IncrementSystem.sol#L22

Package.json: https://github.com/emersonhsieh/mud-noise-bug/blob/main/packages/contracts/package.json

(cf. https://github.com/latticexyz/mud/issues/439#issuecomment-1446111854)
